intro: Tibouchina cujabensis, commonly known as the Cuja bush, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest of South America. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its vibrant purple to pink flowers that bloom throughout the wet season. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Tibouchina cujabensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and nectar for various pollinators.
